numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Many young adults are optimistic about the future.
2. We noticed that many people who are 15-24 years old have hope for the future.
3. In India, many people who are 40+ years old are optimistic about the future.
4. In Indonesia, many people who are 40+ years old are optimistic about the future.
5. In Nigeria, many people who are 40+ years old are optimistic about the future.
6. It is obvious that younger generations are more optimistic about the future of our society.
7. We wonder why these young adults think that the world is getting better.
8. We wonder why Brazil has little optimism about the future.
9. We wonder why Mali has little optimism about the future.
10. We think that some people in Brazil live a poor life now.
11. We think that some people in Mali live a poor life now.
12. We think that a poor life can reduce hope for the future.
13. We wonder what people think when they answer this question.
14. Some people may think that the world will become more peaceful.
15. Some people may think that their own life will get better.
17. We are part of the 15-24-year-old group.
18. It is interesting that many people of our age have hope for the future.
19. It is interesting to see what the 40+ group thinks about the future.
